titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2575) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the 30-hour threshold for classification as a full-time employee for purposes of the employer mandate in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act and replace it with 40 hours.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-397, by Mr. Burgess.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2575 with 3 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 95.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 530.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 229 - 194 (Roll no. 152).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 236 - 186 (Roll no. 153).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 4/1/2014--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2575) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the 30-hour threshold for classification as a full-time employee for purposes of the employer mandate in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act and replace it with 40 hours.
